description: System-generated primary key for this work order record; unique and immutable for internal linking.
Internal identifier for the work order; may duplicate the primary key or be a legacy key; confirm with SME.
Business work order number used on screens, prints, and communications; unique per work order.
Free-text summary of the issue, repair, or service requested/performed.
Identifier of the maintenance schedule or calendar entry associated with this work; likely a foreign key.
Code indicating the category of work (e.g., corrective, preventive, inspection); drives routing and rules.
Lifecycle status code of the work order (e.g., open, in progress, completed); used for workflow and reporting.
System-calculated priority value derived from rules/SLAs to sequence work.
User-assigned priority that can override the calculated priority; confirm behavior with SME.
Date/time work actually began.
Date/time the work order was created in the system.
Planned start date/time for performing the work.
Requested due-by date/time when the requester needs completion.
Date/time the work order document was printed.
Date/time the work was finished and closed.
Date/time the work order was canceled.
Identifier of the supervising person responsible for this work order.
Associated project or capital program the work is charged to; likely a project code.
Reason code explaining why the work was initiated (e.g., breakdown, inspection); used for analysis.
Indicator or code for recorded delays on the work order; confirm definition and values with SME.
Flag indicating whether to charge costs to the default general ledger account.
General ledger account to which labor, parts, and costs for this work will be charged.
Definition for splitting costs across multiple GL accounts; may reference a split template; confirm format.
Identifier of the person who assigned the work.
External reference or related document number linked to this work order.
Required trade/skill for the assignment (e.g., mechanic, electrician).
Work shift code for scheduling resources (e.g., day, night).
Name or identifier of the person who requested the work.
Contact phone or extension for the requester.
Identifier of the warehouse supplying parts/materials for this work order.
Flag indicating the work order was created from a submitted work request.
Identifier of the asset maintenance procedure tied to the scheduled task; confirm with SME.
Flag to carry forward remaining reserved parts to subsequent work; confirm behavior.
Flag to carry forward remaining miscellaneous costs to subsequent work; confirm behavior.
Flag to carry forward remaining resource reservations or allocations; confirm behavior.
System timestamp of the most recent update to this record.
Building or site code where the work is performed.
Floor identifier within the building for the work location; naming suggests facility floor.
Room or specific area within the facility where the work occurs.
Categorized problem or failure type reported for this work order.
Person who approved or authorized the work to proceed.
Alternate work order identifier used by the system; may mirror the business number; confirm with SME.
Flag permitting GL account changes on this work order.
Flag indicating the needed-by date was manually entered rather than system-derived.
Customer or internal cost center to be served/billed for this work; confirm scope.
Flag to consolidate this work orderâ€™s charges with others on a single invoice.
Timestamp of the last modification performed by a user (auditable user activity).
Original scheduled date/time before any rescheduling.
User identifier who created the work order.
Timestamp when the creating user saved the work order.
User identifier who last modified the work order.
Timestamp when the last modifying user saved changes.
